Ubuntu California is a group of volunteers who advocate and promote Ubuntu and Free Software in California. We attend and plan events statewide, contact and work with LUGs and other local groups, and act as the public face of the Ubuntu community in California. The group is open to everybody in the state with an interest in spreading and discussing Ubuntu. 

=== Key Details ===

* '''Date''' - 2009 September 22
* '''Team Contact''' - <nowiki>[[NealBussett|Neal Bussett]]</nowiki> <>
* '''Membership''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-california/+members|186]]</nowiki> as of September 21st, 2009
* '''Launchpad''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-california]]</nowiki>
* '''Mailing List''' - <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-us-ca|ubuntu-us-ca]]</nowiki> on lists.ubuntu.com (151 subscribed as of Sept. 21)
* '''IRC''' - #ubuntu-california on Freenode (IRC meetings every other Sunday)
* '''Forums''' - <nowiki>[[http://california.ubuntuforums.org/]]</nowiki>
* '''Microblogs''' - <nowiki>[[http://identi.ca/ubuntucalifornia|Identi.ca]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://twitter.com/ubuntu_us_ca|Twitter]]</nowiki> (same data as identi.ca)
* '''Other''' - <nowiki>[[http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=33733199182|Facebook]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://linux.com/community/groups/viewgroup/878-UbuntuUSCA|Linux.com]]</nowiki>

==== Goals ====

===== Short(er) term =====
* SCaLE8x (Feb 2010) (<nowiki>[[Yasumoto]]</nowiki>)
* OSCON 2010 (<nowiki>[[Yasumoto]]</nowiki>)
* Come up with improved ways of making CDs look more professional (<nowiki>[[NealBussett]]</nowiki>)
** Redesign general purpose <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-CDSleeves|sleeves]]</nowiki>
** Redesign CD stand & sleeves (together) for specialized use (specific version, flavor, etc) such as putting in libraries
** Come up with a cheap method of making the CDs look good
* <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-Podcast|Ubuntu California Podcast]]</nowiki> (<nowiki>[[NathanHaines]]</nowiki>)
* IRC channel migration
* Launchpad membership cleanup
 
===== Long Term =====

* Presentations at more groups in California (especially non-technical ones)
* Ubuntu on campus
* Two LoCo members per county

===== June 2008: Presentation at the North Orange County Computer Club =====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:noccc_presentation.jpg|photo from NOCCC presentation]]</nowiki>
|}
The North Orange County Computer Club asked us to give a presentation about Linux and Ubuntu.  There were about 50 people in attendance and we handed out a number of CDs and business cards.  The audience was mostly unaware of Linux and open source in general, and seemed enthusiastic about the concept of Linux.

|-

===== July 2009: Booth at the 2009 O'Reilly Open Source Convention =====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:booth_corner.jpg|photo from OSCON 2009 booth]]</nowiki>
|}
We manned a booth at the O'Reilly Open Source Convention (OSCON) in San Jose and handed out about 200 CDs during the two-day Expo Hall. Our booth was one of the more popular ones; we showed off Ubuntu Netbook Remix and did a raffle for the new edition of The Official Ubuntu Server Book.
** <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-OSCON2009|Project page]]</nowiki>
